title: Providing an Order of Succession Within the Office of Management and Budget

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes the line of officials who will take over as Acting Director of the Office of Management and Budget if both the Director and Deputy Director are unable to serve. It also clarifies exceptions, ensures compliance with existing laws, and revokes a previous order on the same topic.
potential_concerns: The codified order of succession may limit the President's flexibility to appoint acting Directors outside the predefined hierarchy, potentially constraining responsiveness during crises or transitions affecting political appointees.
Officials next in line for acting Director roles might face increased pressure or politicization, impacting office stability and potentially affecting government efficiency.
Ambiguities in eligibility under the Federal Vacancies Reform Act could cause confusion or legal challenges for acting officials within the succession order, complicating continuity of operations.
Excluding individuals in acting roles from succession may reduce the pool of available qualified candidates, possibly delaying leadership transitions in the Office of Management and Budget.
